revised_title: The Effect of Solvent on Reaction Velocity: A Study of Chlorination Reactions
tldr: This study investigates the effect of solvents on the reaction velocity of chlorination reactions. The authors found that the reaction rates are faster in solvents with higher cohesion, and the observed critical increments are significantly lower than the calculated values. This suggests that the reaction mechanism may involve ionization of one of the reagents as a precursor, and the observed critical increments may involve the heats of ionization.
